adm6 - python classes¶

class adm6.adm6configparser.Adm6ConfigParser(cfg_file)¶

Read global configuration from configfile named as parameter

dec_adm6_debuglevel()¶

decrement debuglevel by one

get_adm6_debuglevel()¶

get applicationwide debuglevel

get_adm6_home()¶

return adm6 homedir as read from config-file

get_apply(device)¶

give back applyflag (missing flag means true always!)

get_asym(device)¶

give back asymmetric-flag (true means device does asymmetric IPv6 routing!) asymmetric = 1 forces stateful to off

get_desc(device)¶

give description of named device

get_device_home(device)¶

give directory of device as full pathname

get_devices()¶

give a list of all devices named in global section

get_fwd(device)¶

give back fwdflag (false means device does not forward IPv6!)

get_ip(device)¶

give IP of named device

get_key_filename()¶

return ssh key_file read from config-flie

get_os(device)¶

give OS-String of named device

get_show_cf()¶

return complete content as dict of dicts

get_software()¶

give a list of all os-software named in global section

get_version()¶

return version string read from config-flie

inc_adm6_debuglevel()¶

increment debuglevel

nice_print(title, mytext)¶

nice printout of a config line, only to impress the user used linelength: 70 characters

print_all_headers()¶

print all device headers (for debug purposes only)

print_head(device)¶

print a nice header for named device-section

print_header()¶

print nice header as top of every generated output

set_adm6_debuglevel(level)¶

set applicationwide debuglevel

class adm6.hostnet6.HostNet6(file='reference-hostnet')¶

Instance is content of hostnet6-file as a sorted list of lists of: (name,address!!!es!!!) every line in file may be like: NAME ADDRESS # COMMENT or # COMMENT

append(filename)¶

append content of file to entries

get_addrs(name)¶

return list of addresses belonging to a name

nice_print(title, mytext)¶

nice printout of a config line, only to impress the user used linelength: 70 characters

show_addr(name)¶

print addresses belonging to name

show_hostnet6()¶

show all current entries

class adm6.filter6.IP6_Filter(debuglevel, path, name, os, fwd, asym, interfaces=None)¶

Devicetype mostly independant Filter

append(rule)¶

append another rule to the end of the creation list

final_this_rule(rule, outfile)¶

do output for one pair out of rule-nr into file: outfile, convert simple list-structure in rule into Rule-UserDict-Object

mach_output(fname=None)¶

construct header, rules and footer altogether

mangle_file(outfile, mangleinclude)¶

include a file into the outputfile, paketmangling or whatever

class adm6.filter6.Ip6_Filter_Rule(dict=None, **kwargs)¶

IP6_Filter_Rule is a container with all the neccessary stuff for device-type independant filter-generation. It is filled by reading all the specific device-files of one device, device-type is one out of (Debian, OpenBSD, OpenSolaris) interfaces, routing-table, hostnet6 and all device-rules

produce_Debian(outfile, commented)¶

do one pair of src-dst out of a rule for Debian

produce_IPF(outfile, commented)¶

do one pair out of a rule for Free-, Net-BSD, OpenSolaris

produce_OpenBSD(outfile, commented)¶

do one pair of src-dst out of a rule for OpenBSD

produce_wxpsp3(outfile, commented)¶

do one pair of src-dst out of a rule for Win-XP-SP3

class adm6.device.ThisDevice(device, confParser, hostnet)¶

Object keeps all sampled information about a device, information is read from a subdirectory in adm6/desc/ interface-config (output of ifconfig) and routing-table (output of ip -6 route show) and filter-rules (plain ascii-filese with defs and actions) might be useful for other things than generating filters

address_is_own(value)¶

check, if given address is interface-address of ThisDevice returns Name of Interface or None

do_rules(filter)¶

invocation: dev.do_rules(filter)

do_this_rule(clone, rn, filter6, rh, sr, ds, pr, po, ac, op)¶

build os-independant detailed rule without options, which are very os-specific

interface_line(line)¶

evaluate one line of ifconfig-output store results in self.interfaces = [] !!! specific on os-type !!!

look_for(addr)¶

seeks addr in routing-table, returns tuple of interface-name and line number of routing-entry

read_interface_file(filename)¶

read plain file containing output of Win-XP-SP3: netsh, see adm6-ini.bat Debian: ifconfig OpenBSD: ifconfig

read_one_rule(line)¶

take one line of a rules-file, check and do the appropriate

read_routingtab_file(filename=None)¶

read plain file containg output of Debian: ip -6 route show OpenBSD: route -n show

read_rule_file(file)¶

read given file as rules for the machine

read_rules()¶

read all the rule-files in a machines homedir

routingtab_line(line)¶

read a line using os-spcific version

show_interfaces()¶

nice view of all interfacesconfiguration read

show_routingtab()¶

nice view of all routingconfiguration read

show_rules()¶

show all rules as text before addresses are solved

test_07_show_hostnet()¶
